body.p:
The Enhanced Contractor Board () provides twice as many relays and building alarms as the Basic Contractor Board. The Enhanced Contractor Board is used in other Eaton PDI products and many of the connectors are not used on PDUs. Enhanced Contractor Board
24VDC Power Input: Unlike the Basic Contractor Board, the Enhanced Contractor Board has a processor and uses 24VDC power from the PDU M4G Board.
Remote EPO: Dry contact connection point for input of a REPO signal to system. Connection of voltage to this point can cause damage to the unit. Connect external dry contacts to terminals marked +24V EPO RET. The REPO signal is sent to the PDU Board via the REMOTE EPO connection, which is not a customer connection point.
Eight (8) Building Alarms. Alarm names can be specified by Eaton PDI in PDU Board setup.

li.p: Eight (8) remote relays that output dry contact (NO) signals. (Note: Remote relays can accept dry contacts rated up to 2A/250V.)

Relays are programmable using the USB setup connection on the PDU M4G Board. Eaton PDI programs the relay inputs in manufacturing. For example, a relay can be programmed to turn on when a specific building alarm, such as a fire alarm, is received. The building information management (BIM) system or other control system receives the relay signal and can cause PDU shutdown with an REPO signal.
By default, the first relay RR1 is programmed to close when the PDU Summary Alarm, PDU Board points list, Modbus Register 70, is in alarm state.

body.p: Modbus RTU Connection: 4-wire paralleled upstream and downstream connectors. (To set 2-wire Modbus upstream to customer DCIM or BIM systems, set jumpers on the Color Monitor backpanel at W1 and W2. See section Customer Network Connections and .)
